item.title: GOP Senators Ask GAO To Investigate High Prices For Orphan Drugs
item.description: March 7, 2017 - Amid an uproar over soaring drug prices, three GOP senators are seeking an investigation into whether the Orphan Drug Act is being manipulated to jack up the cost of medications for rare diseases.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 7, 2017 - Amid an uproar over soaring drug prices, three GOP senators are seeking an investigation into whether the Orphan Drug Act is being manipulated to jack up the cost of medications for rare diseases. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/07/518980280/gop-senators-ask-gao-to-investigate-high-prices-for-orphan-drugs

item.title: GOP Bill: Repeals Parts Of Obamacare, Retains Some Subsidies
item.description: March 7, 2017 - House Republicans have released their plan to reshape the Affordable Care Act, also known as Obamacare. It faces challenges from within the party, interest groups and the public.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 7, 2017 - House Republicans have released their plan to reshape the Affordable Care Act, also known as Obamacare. It faces challenges from within the party, interest groups and the public. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/07/518956919/gop-bill-repeals-parts-of-obamacare-retains-some-subsidies

item.title: House Republicans Release Affordable Care Act Replacement Bill
item.description: March 6, 2017 - House Republicans released their plan on Monday to redo the Affordable Care Act. Congressional Republicans have voted several times to repeal the law, but President Obama vetoed those attempts.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 6, 2017 - House Republicans released their plan on Monday to redo the Affordable Care Act. Congressional Republicans have voted several times to repeal the law, but President Obama vetoed those attempts. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/06/518888233/house-republicans-release-affordable-care-act-replacement-bill

item.title: GOP Bill Would Repeal Obamacare Taxes And Penalties, Keep Some Subsidies
item.description: March 6, 2017 - After weeks of internal debate, House Republicans have released their plan for the Affordable Care Act, aka Obamacare. It faces challenges from within the GOP, from interest groups — and the public.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 6, 2017 - After weeks of internal debate, House Republicans have released their plan for the Affordable Care Act, aka Obamacare. It faces challenges from within the GOP, from interest groups — and the public. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/06/518864390/gop-bill-would-repeal-obamacare-taxes-and-penalties-keep-some-subsidies

item.title: New Study Reveals Benefits Of Soy For Breast Cancer Survivors
item.description: March 6, 2017 - A new study shows many breast cancer survivors benefit from a diet that includes soy, such as soy milk and tofu. The study comes as alternative plant-based proteins boom.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 6, 2017 - A new study shows many breast cancer survivors benefit from a diet that includes soy, such as soy milk and tofu. The study comes as alternative plant-based proteins boom. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/06/518858364/new-study-reveals-benefits-of-soy-for-breast-cancer-survivors

item.title: Reports Of Medical Breakthroughs Often Don't Prove Out
item.description: March 6, 2017 - Medical breakthroughs that were covered by newspapers were often later disproved by more comprehensive research, a study finds. That's a problem for scientists and journalists.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 6, 2017 - Medical breakthroughs that were covered by newspapers were often later disproved by more comprehensive research, a study finds. That's a problem for scientists and journalists. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/06/518802242/reports-of-medical-breakthroughs-often-dont-prove-out

item.title: Unscrambling The Nutrition Science On Eggs
item.description: March 6, 2017 - As more research suggests some degree of dietary cholesterol is harmless, if not healthy, the egg's reputation is slowly returning. Yet some experts worry the science is being misinterpreted and spun.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 6, 2017 - As more research suggests some degree of dietary cholesterol is harmless, if not healthy, the egg's reputation is slowly returning. Yet some experts worry the science is being misinterpreted and spun. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/03/06/518152471/unscrambling-the-nutrition-science-on-eggs

item.title: Feeling Lonely? Too Much Time On Social Media May Be Why
item.description: March 6, 2017 - It's not clear whether spending a lot of time on Facebook, Snapchat or Instagram leads to social isolation, or whether the lonely seek solace in social media.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 6, 2017 - It's not clear whether spending a lot of time on Facebook, Snapchat or Instagram leads to social isolation, or whether the lonely seek solace in social media. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/06/518362255/feeling-lonely-too-much-time-on-social-media-may-be-why

item.title: Did You Get Bit By A Lyme-Infested Tick? Here's What To Do
item.description: March 6, 2017 - One scientist is predicting a risky year for tick-borne Lyme disease in the Northeast, and it's spreading. But don't panic. We've got tips.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 6, 2017 - One scientist is predicting a risky year for tick-borne Lyme disease in the Northeast, and it's spreading. But don't panic. We've got tips. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/06/518065660/if-you-get-bit-by-a-lyme-infested-tick-here-are-5-tips

item.title: Forbidding Forecast For Lyme Disease In The Northeast
item.description: March 6, 2017 - Lyme disease is spreading, and this summer is shaping up as a whopper. Why has the tick-borne illness gotten so bad? The answer traces back to something the colonists did more than 200 years ago.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 6, 2017 - Lyme disease is spreading, and this summer is shaping up as a whopper. Why has the tick-borne illness gotten so bad? The answer traces back to something the colonists did more than 200 years ago. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/03/06/518219485/forbidding-forecast-for-lyme-disease-in-the-northeast

item.title: Thomas Starzl, Trailblazer In Organ Transplantation, Dies At 90
item.description: March 5, 2017 - The doctor, who performed the world's first liver transplant surgery in 1963, eventually earned the moniker "father of transplantation."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 5, 2017 - The doctor, who performed the world's first liver transplant surgery in 1963, eventually earned the moniker "father of transplantation." http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/05/518644481/thomas-starzl-trailblazer-in-organ-transplantation-dies-at-90

item.title: A Doctor On Why He Volunteered To Fight Ebola In Liberia
item.description: March 5, 2017 - In 2014, Dr. Steven Hatch traveled to Liberia to treat people infected with the Ebola virus. NPR's Mary Louise Kelly talks with him about his new book, Inferno: A Doctor's Ebola Story.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 5, 2017 - In 2014, Dr. Steven Hatch traveled to Liberia to treat people infected with the Ebola virus. NPR's Mary Louise Kelly talks with him about his new book, Inferno: A Doctor's Ebola Story. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/05/518606152/a-doctor-on-why-he-volunteered-to-fight-ebola-in-liberia

item.title: No One Was Prepared To Care For So Many Wounded In Mosul
item.description: March 5, 2017 - The number of wounded civilians and fighters is higher than expected in the battle to force ISIS from the Iraqi city. Care is coming from several sources, including U.S. forces.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 5, 2017 - The number of wounded civilians and fighters is higher than expected in the battle to force ISIS from the Iraqi city. Care is coming from several sources, including U.S. forces. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/03/05/518360464/no-one-was-prepared-to-care-for-so-many-wounded-in-mosul

item.title: Menstruation 101 For Boys: A Comic Book Is Their Guide
item.description: March 4, 2017 - It's two comic books in one: A guide for boys (so they won't tease girls) and advice for girls on how to handle their period.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 4, 2017 - It's two comic books in one: A guide for boys (so they won't tease girls) and advice for girls on how to handle their period. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/03/04/516628738/menstruation-101-for-boys-a-comic-book-is-their-guide

item.title: Doctor Launches Vision Quest To Help Astronauts' Eyeballs
item.description: March 4, 2017 - Scientists are learning that some astronauts' eyes change shape after time in space, leading to vision problems. But a sleep sack being developed might offer relief.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 4, 2017 - Scientists are learning that some astronauts' eyes change shape after time in space, leading to vision problems. But a sleep sack being developed might offer relief. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/04/518214299/doctor-launches-vision-quest-to-help-astronauts-eyeballs
